signature: void putAll(Map<? extends K, ? extends V>)

enhanced_by.reason: putAll internally uses put to add each entry from the specified map, making it a direct precursor for setting up the map state.
Clearing the map before invoking putAll can help in setting up a clean state for testing the method.
Wrapping putAll inside atomic ensures that the operation is executed atomically, which can be crucial for thread-safe testing scenarios.
Invoking size after putAll can help verify the correct number of entries added to the map.
